intro: Ouratea pastazana, commonly known as the Pastaza ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in the humid and shaded conditions of the tropical forest. Its botanical features make it an important component of the rainforest's biodiversity.
